subject: Re: [junit] Re: how can make an exception as a true condition
msgSnippet: On Fri, 05 Nov 2004 16:27:19 -0500, J. B. Rainsberger ... Agreed. ... I realized that, too. I also realized it s because I tend to make further checks within
messageBody:
On Fri, 05 Nov 2004 16:27:19 -0500, J. B. Rainsberger
<jbrains@...> wrote:
> If you see this:
>
> catch (Exception expected) {}
>
> ...might you not question whether the code /really/ expects /any/
> exception? I would. If I didn't trust the code -- for example because I
> had no idea who wrote it -- I'd investigate a little.

Agreed.


> Plus I don't see why anyone's more likely to type "catch (Exception
> ...)" using the standard approach or your approach.

I realized that, too. I also realized it's because I tend to make
further checks within the catch block, and I just liked to do an
assertTrue on one variable - which I then realized you can also do
using the more common form. I guess it boils down to matter of taste.

- alistair
